Class EmailValidatorTest

java.lang.Object
EmailValidatorTest
public class EmailValidatorTest extends Object
Unit tests for the EmailValidator class.

This test class verifies the correct functionality of the validateEmail method by checking various valid and invalid email inputs according to defined criteria.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Method Details

    • testEmptyEmail

      @Test public void testEmptyEmail()
      Tests the validateEmail method with an empty email string. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testMissingAtSymbol

      @Test public void testMissingAtSymbol()
      Tests the validateEmail method with a missing '@' symbol. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testEmptyDomain

      @Test public void testEmptyDomain()
      Tests the validateEmail method with an empty domain part. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testDomainWithoutDot

      @Test public void testDomainWithoutDot()
      Tests the validateEmail method with a domain that lacks a dot. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testInvalidLocalCharacter

      @Test public void testInvalidLocalCharacter()
      Tests the validateEmail method with an invalid character in the local part of the email. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testValidEmail

      @Test public void testValidEmail()
      Tests the validateEmail method with a valid email address. Ensures no exception is thrown for a properly formatted email.
